Summary I am a Lead Business Planner in the CPU planning division at Intel Corporation. My division is responsible for supply chain manufacturing, and aligning supply to demand while minimizing excess inventory and meeting all customer demand. We strategically align supply to demand near term, while monitoring leading indicators to alleviate any anticipated manufacturing or inventory issues. 
 
I focus on the business environment, and strive to maintain the best supply and service for the customers while maintaining corporate business strategies. I have been a key driver of new processes to optimize customer satisfaction while minimizing inventory levels. I am self-motivated and continuously identify issues, risks, and implement constructive solutions across organizational teams. 
 
Over the past 10 years I have held multiple positions at Intel Corporation: Lead Business Planner, Product Marketing Engineer, Team Manager, Inventory Analyst, Business Analyst, and Customer Service Analyst. I have been directly responsible for the NPI (new product introduction) of many different product lines (Server/Mobile/Desktop).  
• Managed several product recalls and worked with engineering, manufacturing, and sales and marketing to minimize customer impact from any manufacturing issues.  
•Worked with sales and marketing to align forecasted demand signals to what customers are ordering.  
•Managed yield issues with engineering and manufacturing teams.  
•Compiled and reported out inventory levels for the division and influenced management decisions.  
•Monitored orders in SAP to be sure orders maintain a high level of customer requested delivery dates. Summary I am a Lead Business Planner in the CPU planning division at Intel Corporation.
